sourcesContent:
import * as React from 'react';

import Grid from '@mui/material/Unstable_Grid2';
import Container from '@mui/material/Container';

import Main from './Main';
import Typography from '@mui/material/Typography';
import { styled } from '@mui/material/styles';
import { Box, Paper, Skeleton } from '@mui/material';
import List from '@mui/material/List';
import ListItem from '@mui/material/ListItem';
import ListItemButton from '@mui/material/ListItemButton';
import ListItemIcon from '@mui/material/ListItemIcon';
import ListItemText from '@mui/material/ListItemText';
import Divider from '@mui/material/Divider';
import InboxIcon from '@mui/icons-material/Inbox';
import DraftsIcon from '@mui/icons-material/Drafts';

const main = {
    title: 'Title Of A Course ',
    description:
        'Lorem ipsum dolor sit, amet consectetur adipisicing elit. Atque ex, voluptatibus doloribus iusto aperiam porro!',
    image: 'https://source.unsplash.com/random',
    imageText: 'main image description',
    linkText: 'Continue readingâ€¦',
};

export default function Course() {
    return (
        <Container maxWidth='lg' sx={{ marginTop: '1rem' }}>
            <main>
                <Main post={main} />
            </main>
            <content style={{ margin: '1rem' }}>
                <Grid container spacing={7} m={1}>
                    <Grid xs={7}>
                        <Typography variant='h4' my={4}>
                            Become an HTML5/CSS3 Expert!
                        </Typography>
                        <Typography variant='body1' my={1}>
                            Perhaps you know enough to make small tweaks in existing HTML/CSS code, but struggle to
                            build something from scratch. If you know the basics and are looking for a course that
                            doesnâ€™t treat you like an absolute beginner, look no further.
                        </Typography>

                        <Typography variant='body1' my={1}>
                            A fun, highly-practical, step-by-step course that teaches you the both latest and more
                            complex HTML5/CSS3 concepts such as responsive design, Flex & Grid layout systems,
                            typography, responsive images, organizing CSS and much, much, more.
                        </Typography>

                        <Typography variant='h5' my={4}>
                            No lenghty, boring, repetitive explanations here. Just HTML5/CSS3 explained clearly.
                        </Typography>
                    </Grid>
                    <Grid xs={5}>
                        <Paper elevation={3} sx={{ padding: '1rem' }}>
                            <Box sx={{ width: '100%', maxWidth: 360, bgcolor: 'background.paper' }}>
                                <nav aria-label='main mailbox folders'>
                                    <List>
                                        <ListItem disablePadding>
                                            <ListItemButton>
                                                <ListItemIcon>
                                                    <InboxIcon />
                                                </ListItemIcon>
                                                <ListItemText primary='Inbox' />
                                            </ListItemButton>
                                        </ListItem>
                                        <ListItem disablePadding>
                                            <ListItemButton>
                                                <ListItemIcon>
                                                    <DraftsIcon />
                                                </ListItemIcon>
                                                <ListItemText primary='Drafts' />
                                            </ListItemButton>
                                        </ListItem>
                                    </List>
                                </nav>
                                <Divider />
                                <nav aria-label='secondary mailbox folders'>
                                    <List>
                                        <ListItem disablePadding>
                                            <ListItemButton>
                                                <ListItemText primary='Trash' />
                                            </ListItemButton>
                                        </ListItem>
                                        <ListItem disablePadding>
                                            <ListItemButton component='a' href='#simple-list'>
                                                <ListItemText primary='Spam' />
                                            </ListItemButton>
                                        </ListItem>
                                    </List>
                                </nav>
                            </Box>
                        </Paper>
                    </Grid>
                </Grid>
            </content>
        </Container>
    );
}
